ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to write, revise, critique, and cover a feature length script.

I received extensive feedback about my own screenplay, regarding everything from characterization to plot decisions to dialogue. I grew more adept at giving pointed, constructive criticism to my peers, as well.

This course does an excellent job of elevating expectations and writing production compared to the other screenwriting courses at Yale. This is mostly due to the valuable critiques and expectations that Professor Lapadula sets for his students but, furthermore, being surrounded by like minded artists makes this course an incredible experience and opportunity to better your writing, learn from others, and get real world feedback.
Industry insights from professionals as well as script insights and advice and feedback from classmates, the professor, and the professionals.
Learned about structuring feature length screenplays.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Gives you a space to work on your feature script, and allows you to then bring drafts of that script before not only Prof. Lapadula and your classmates, but industry figures with interesting POVs. Very self-guided, as it is a workshop by design, so those who need strict deadlines may struggle to pace themselves.
I dont think anything could be improved

Strengths: a wealth of feedback from instructor, guest critics, and peers; visits from industry professionals; the opportunity to read and learn from incredible scripts from classmates 
Weaknesses: none that come to mind
We had guests professionals come in to give advice on each student's script which was very helpful and insightful. We got nice feedback from our classmates.
A great community is created amongst the students and we get to learn from many different successful guest critics.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you are taking Advanced, you have likely taken Intermediate and Beginner --- it is more or less a scaled up, year-long version of the same thing. Biggest (positive) change is the inclusion of guest speakers.
If youre hoping to become a better screen writer it is the best way to do it because it serves as a hands-on workshop where you get a lot of work done.

Absolutely! If you are serious about wanting to become a screenwriter, there is no better way to have your screenplay workshopped on campusyou will receive so much useful feedback. You will also get the opportunity to read your classmates' amazing scripts.
Yes, this is a perfect class for students who want to do screenwriting after graduating or something screenwriting or movie related.
It is a requirement of the film major Screenwriting track so if you want to do that, yes.
